cooking_method: Wash the rice and lentils together and soak them in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Heat ghee in a large pan or pressure cooker over medium heat.
Add cumin seeds, cloves, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.
Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add the drained rice and lentils to the pan. Stir and cook for a couple of minutes to coat them with the spices.

Add water and give it a good stir. If using a pressure cooker, close the lid and cook for 2 whistles. If using a pan, cover and cook until the rice and lentils are tender (approximately 20-25 minutes).
Once cooked, let the pressure release naturally if using a pressure cooker.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.
Clean and wash the Hilsa fish. Cut it into pieces and marinate with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Keep aside for 15 minutes.
Heat mustard oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add green chilies, nigella seeds, and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add the marinated fish pieces to the pan. Fry them lightly on both sides until golden brown. Remove from the pan and keep aside.
In the same pan, add mustard paste and cook for a minute.
Add warm water and stir well to form a smooth gravy.
Add fried fish pieces back to the pan and gently coat them with the gravy.
Cover the pan and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the fish is cooked through and the flavors are well incorporated.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
In a bowl, combine rice flour, grated coconut, grated jaggery, cardamom powder, and salt.
Gradually add water and knead the mixture to form a smooth dough. The dough should hold its shape when pressed.
Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into flat discs or cylindrical shapes.
Heat water in a steamer. Line the steamer basket with banana leaves.
Place the shaped dough on the banana leaves and steam for about 15-20 minutes until the pithas are cooked and firm.
Remove from the steamer and let them cool slightly before serving.
Pithas can be served as a snack or dessert.
